overall_perception_summary.headline: The Clinical Relief Architect
overall_perception_summary.description: Dr. Althea positions itself as a precise, medical-grade intervention for compromised skin. It rejects emotional marketing in favor of 'Pharma-Code' aesthetics and 'Spec Sheet' transparency, leveraging the authority of the '345' formula structure to signal engineered relief. It plays the role of the stoic dermatologist who fixes the problem without trying to be your friend.

foundation.title: The Safety Engineer
foundation.description: The brand anchors its authority in the Lab (Clinical Origin) with a singular mission of Repair (Restoration). It prioritizes Safety First above all else, sacrificing mystery for 'Spec Sheet' transparency where every ingredient is listed on the front of the tube. It occupies the Medical Authority slot, framing the product as a necessary utility for pathology rather than a luxury.

identity.title: The Sterile Expert
identity.description: The relationship is defined by high Competence and low Warmth, creating The Reliable Expert persona. Dominated by The Caregiver (60%) and Sage (30%) archetypes, it protects through knowledge. The visual identity is pure Pharma-Code—stark white, black text, and grid layouts—delivered with a Clinical Authority voice that speaks in data ('177% boost') rather than sentences.

communication.title: The Transparent Chemist
communication.description: Messaging hooks the user with The Component (ingredients) and persuades with Raw Data (clinical trials). The USP is The Specialist, claiming ownership of the 'Post-Acne' niche via its proprietary '345' formula structure. The focus is entirely on Science Education, using the PDP as a textbook to prove mechanism rather than inspire desire.

benefits.title: Restorative Peace
benefits.description: Functionally, it delivers Restoration, acting as a 'Fixer' for damaged barriers. The payoff is Emotional Relief—the removal of anxiety regarding skin reactions. Socially, it functions as The Safe Choice, a pragmatic tool for those who want to normalize their skin condition rather than signal status.

marker_1.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] ORIGIN OF AUTHORITY (The Source of Power)
marker_1.reasoning: The brand's authority is rooted in the clinic, evidenced by the 'Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences' seal and the 'Dr.' moniker (Origin: 2/5). The mission is explicitly corrective—focusing on 'Relief,' 'Post-acne marks,' and 'Calming' rather than enhancement or maintenance (Mission: 2/5). It exists to heal a pathology.
marker_1.evidence: Dr. Althea... 345 Relief Cream... Post-acne marks... Skin Soothing TESTED... Suitability for Acne-prone Skin

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (Derm-Validated) + Slider B (Restoration) align perfectly with Territory 1 (The Healer). The content consistently signals clinical correction.

marker_2.slider_b_position_name: ▼ Approachable (Easy to find, easy to buy)
marker_2.reasoning: The scope is hyper-focused on specific skin failures: 'Acne-prone,' 'Sensitive,' and 'Irritation' (Scope: 1/5). Yet, despite the 'Dr.' name, the presentation is approachable and functional rather than exclusive or gatekept (Access: 4/5). It democratizes clinical-grade post-acne relief.
marker_2.evidence: Suitability for Acne-prone Skin... Skin Irritation Tested... light-weight... non-sticky

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (Micro-Correction) + Slider B (Approachable) match the pattern for Territory 1 (The Democratizers). Targeted relief made accessible.

marker_3.slider_b_position_name: ▼ The Spec Sheet (Exact percentages, pH, full disclosure)
marker_3.reasoning: The product prioritizes tolerance above all else, with claims like 'Hypoallergenic,' 'Soothing,' and specific testing for 'Sensitive Skin' (Performance: 2/5). Transparency is absolute—the packaging design literally *is* the ingredient list, categorizing every component by function (Transparency: 1/5).
marker_3.evidence: Skin Irritation Tested For Sensitive Skin... Vegan... Full transparency with complete ingredient... disclosure

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (Gentle) + Slider B (Spec Sheet) clearly define Territory 1 (Safety First). The visual strategy of listing ingredients on the tube reinforces this.

marker_4.reasoning: The aesthetic is stark white, black text, and laboratory grid layouts—pure 'Sterile' coding (Aesthetic: 1/5). The value proposition is a functional necessity for problem skin ('Relief Cream') rather than a status object or luxury item (Value: 2/5). It belongs in the medicine cabinet, not the vanity shelf.
marker_4.evidence: Stark black on white... Clinical-style tube... Squeeze tube packaging with industrial crimp details

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (Sterile) + Slider B (Essential) align with Territory 1 (Medical Authority). The entire visual language mimics pharmaceutical packaging.

marker_5.reasoning: There is no attempt to be friends. The language is data-driven ('177% boost', 'EE023') and distant (Warmth: 2/5). The authority stance is high, leveraging the 'Dr.' title and institute seals to speak from a position of specialized knowledge (Authority: 4/5).
marker_5.evidence: Dr. Althea... 177% immediate boost... Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences... EE023

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (Distant) + Slider B (Specialist) map to Territory 3 (The Reliable Expert). The brand maintains professional distance and relies on competence.

marker_6.reasoning: The dominant signal is Caregiver (60%)—protecting the vulnerable ('Sensitive,' 'Acne-prone,' 'Relief,' 'Soothing'). This is supported by Sage (30%)—the transparency of the '345' ingredient list and clinical data. A hint of Ruler (10%) appears via the 'Dr.' title and certification seals, asserting control over the condition.
marker_6.evidence: Relief Cream... Soothing protection... Skin Irritation Tested... Dr. Althea... 345... Ingredient transparency

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Marker 6 uses percentage distribution. Dominance of Caregiver (Control/Stability) creates The Guardian territory.

marker_7.reasoning: The voice is devoid of humor or hype. It speaks in clinical assertions: 'Clinical trial completed,' 'Suitability for acne-prone skin.' This is the voice of a diagnosis or a lab report—dry, traditional, and serious.
marker_7.evidence: Clinical trial completed... Suitability for Acne-prone Skin... 177% immediate boost

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Low Humor (1) + Low Enthusiasm (2) + Traditional Formality (2) meets the hard rule for Territory 1 (The Clinical Authority).

marker_8.reasoning: The visual language is stark and medical. The palette is dominated by white and black with clinical green accents (Thermostat: 1/5). The layouts are rigid grids, vertical text stacks, and infographic boxes (Entropy: 1/5). It looks like it belongs in a pharmacy behind the counter.
marker_8.evidence: Stark black on white... Vertical ingredient breakdown text... Squeeze tube packaging with industrial crimp details... Pale sage green and clinical seals
marker_8.look_and_feel: A stark, minimalist clinical aesthetic that uses white space and grid typography to signal pharmaceutical precision.
marker_8.primary_palette: High-contrast monochromatic white and black with accents of clinical sage green.

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (Sterile) + Slider B (Swiss Grid) align perfectly with Territory 1 (Pharma-Code).

marker_9.reasoning: The messaging hook is the component list itself—'345' stands for the ingredients, which are listed on the front. Persuasion is driven by raw data: '177% hydration boost,' 'Clinical trial completed.' It assumes the user is smart enough to read the chemistry.
marker_9.evidence: 345... Ingredient list... 177% immediate boost... Clinical trial completed

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (Component) + Slider B (Raw Data) align with Territory 1 (The Chemist). The brand sells the nouns via data.

marker_10.reasoning: The protagonist is 'Dr. Althea'—a persona of professional expertise (Slider A: 2/5). The setting is a sterile environment of 'Clinical Trials,' 'Institutes,' and industrial batch codes (Slider B: 1/5). It's a story of scientific formulation, not a founder's emotional journey.
marker_10.evidence: Dr. Althea... Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences... Batch code EE023... Clinical Trial Completed

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (Professional) + Slider B (Sterile) align with Territory 1 (The Lab Breakthrough). The narrative is grounded in professional expertise and clinical settings.

marker_11.reasoning: Validation comes directly from the 'Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences' (The Board). The proof is presented as hard data—'177% boost' and 'Skin Irritation Tested' seals (The Graph). Even the vegan icon is treated like a certification rather than a lifestyle vibe.
marker_11.evidence: Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences... 177% immediate boost... Dermatologist inspired... Clinical badges

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (The Board) + Slider B (The Graph) align perfectly with Territory 1 (Derm-Validation). Authority and data are the primary currencies.

marker_12.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] THE OWNERSHIP CLAIM (What Makes You Unique)
marker_12.slider_b_label: [SLIDER] THE TARGET SCOPE (How Wide Is The Net?)
marker_12.slider_b_position_name: ▼ The Problem Solver (Targets specific skin concern)
marker_12.reasoning: The brand owns the '345' numerical code as a Signature Complex representing its formulation philosophy (Ownership: 3/5). The scope is narrow and problem-focused: 'Post-acne,' 'Blemish,' and 'Sensitive' skin (Scope: 4/5). It is the Specialist for this specific condition.
marker_12.evidence: 345 Relief Cream... Post-acne recovery... Suitability for Acne-prone Skin... Blemish care

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (Signature Complex) + Slider B (Problem Solver) matches Territory 4 (The Specialist). The brand leverages a specific formula structure to solve a specific niche problem.

marker_13.reasoning: The content purpose is education—breaking down ingredients, explaining the '345' concept, and showing clinical test results (Depth: 1/5). The intent is to prove the thesis of safety and efficacy via seals and data (Intent: 1/5).
marker_13.evidence: Vertical ingredient breakdown... Clinical trial seals... Infographic layout... 177% boost

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (Textbook) + Slider B (Thesis) align with Territory 1 (Science Education). The PDP functions as a clinical proof document.

marker_14.reasoning: The product is a 'Relief Cream' designed for 'Post-acne recovery' and 'Soothing'—it exists to fix damage (Action: 5/5). The outcome is biological health: strengthening the barrier, hydration, and non-comedogenic safety, rather than cosmetic perfection (Outcome: 1/5).
marker_14.evidence: Relief Cream... Post-acne recovery... Skin Soothing... Strengthens skin barrier

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (Fixer) + Slider B (Biological) align with Territory 1 (Restoration). The focus is on repairing compromised skin biology.

marker_15.slider_b_position_name: ▼ Sanctuary (I feel safe inside my own body)
marker_15.reasoning: For a customer with 'Acne-prone' or 'Sensitive' skin, the primary emotion is Reassurance—knowing the product won't cause a breakout (Anxiety: 2/5). The benefit is internal safety and a return to normal ('Sanctuary'), not public status (Self-Perception: 1/5).
marker_15.evidence: Relief... Soothing... Safe for sensitive skin... Hypoallergenic

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (Reassurance) + Slider B (Sanctuary) align with Territory 1 (Relief/Safety). The brand sells the absence of fear.

marker_16.slider_a_position_name: ▼ The Tool (I buy it only because it functions)
marker_16.slider_b_position_name: ▼ The Standard (What everyone uses; the default)
marker_16.reasoning: This is a purchase driven by logic: 'I have post-acne marks, this fixes them.' It is a Tool (Signal: 1/5). There is no strong tribal signal here; it aligns with the 'Standard' behavior of treating a condition (Tribal: 1/5).
marker_16.evidence: Relief Cream... Suitability for Acne-prone Skin... Clinical Trial Completed

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (Tool) + Slider B (Standard) align with Territory 1 (The Pragmatist). The purchase is purely functional and rational.

marker_17.slider_a_position_name: ▼ Normalization ('I want to look like everyone else')
marker_17.reasoning: The goal of using an acne relief cream is Normalization—to return to the baseline of clear skin like the majority (Vector: 1/5). By buying a clinically tested product, the user joins the 'Safe' crowd who trusts science (Group: 1/5).
marker_17.evidence: Post-acne recovery... Suitability for Acne-prone Skin... Clinical validation

evaluation_check.coherence_reasoning: Slider A (Normalization) + Slider B (Majority) align with Territory 1 (The Safe Choice). The social goal is to fix the problem and blend in.
